title: School Management App with Teacher & Student Roles

requirements.text: Implement a backend data model and actor with the following entities: Teacher (id, username, passwordHash), Student (id, name, username, passwordHash), Attendance (studentId, date, status: present/absent), Mark (studentId, subject, score, maxScore, semester), Event (id, title, description, date), Semester (id, name, startDate, endDate), SemesterExamResult (studentId, semesterId, subject, score, maxScore), Complaint (id, studentId, message, timestamp). Store all entities in stable variables.

quotes: attends and marks and events and semester exams

acceptanceCriteria: All data types are defined and stored in stable variables in main.mo
Data persists across canister upgrades

requirements.text: Implement teacher authentication: a pre-seeded teacher account (username: 'teacher', password: 'teacher123') that can log in and receive a session token. Expose login and logout functions on the backend.

quotes: give it a login option to enter the app only for teacher only

acceptanceCriteria: Teacher can log in with correct credentials and receive a valid session
Invalid credentials return an error
Teacher session grants full admin access

requirements.text: Implement student account creation by the teacher: the teacher can create new student accounts with a name, username, and password. Students can then log in with those credentials. Expose createStudent, studentLogin, and studentLogout functions on the backend.
acceptanceCriteria: Teacher can create a new student account
Student can log in with the created credentials
Student session only grants access to their own data

requirements.text: Implement backend functions for attendance management: addAttendance (teacher only), updateAttendance (teacher only), getAttendanceByStudent (accessible by teacher for any student, and by the student for their own record), getAttendanceAll (teacher only).

quotes: give access to me to all of it

acceptanceCriteria: Teacher can add and update attendance records
Student can only view their own attendance
Unauthorized access returns an error

requirements.text: Implement backend functions for marks management: addMark (teacher only), updateMark (teacher only), getMarksByStudent (teacher for all, student for own), getAllMarks (teacher only).
acceptanceCriteria: Teacher can add and edit marks for any student
Student can only view their own marks
Marks are associated with a subject and semester

requirements.text: Implement backend functions for events management: createEvent (teacher only), updateEvent (teacher only), deleteEvent (teacher only), getAllEvents (accessible by both teacher and students).
acceptanceCriteria: Teacher can create, update, and delete events
All logged-in users can view events

requirements.text: Implement backend functions for semester and semester exam results management: addSemester (teacher only), getSemesters (all authenticated users), addSemesterExamResult (teacher only), getSemesterExamResultsByStudent (teacher for all, student for own).
acceptanceCriteria: Teacher can add semesters and exam results
Students can view their own semester exam results
Results are linked to a semester and student

requirements.text: Implement backend functions for the student complaint box: submitComplaint (student only, submits a complaint message associated with their studentId), getAllComplaints (teacher only, returns all complaints with student name and timestamp).

quotes: give only access see to marks and attendance events and semester

acceptanceCriteria: Students can submit a complaint
Teacher can view all submitted complaints with student name and timestamp
Students cannot view other students' complaints

requirements.text: Build a login page as the app entry point. It should have two login forms: one for the teacher and one for students. After successful login, redirect to the appropriate dashboard based on role. Include a 'Sign in as Teacher' and 'Sign in as Student' tab or toggle.

quotes: give it a login option to enter the app

acceptanceCriteria: Login page is shown before any app content
Teacher and student login are clearly separated
Successful login routes to the correct dashboard
Error message is shown for invalid credentials

requirements.text: Build a Teacher Dashboard with navigation sections: Students, Attendance, Marks, Events, Semesters & Exams, and Complaints. The teacher can: create student accounts; enter and edit attendance per student per date; enter and edit marks per student per subject per semester; create/edit/delete events; add semesters and enter semester exam results per student; view all student complaints.

quotes: give access to me to all of it
name's marks entering and adding semester

acceptanceCriteria: All six sections are accessible from a sidebar or tab navigation
Teacher can create new student accounts from the Students section
Attendance, marks, and semester exam results have forms for data entry
Events section allows full CRUD
Complaints section displays all student complaints in a readable list

requirements.text: Build a Student Dashboard with read-only sections: My Attendance, My Marks, Events, My Semester Results, and Complaint Box. Students can view their own attendance records, marks, upcoming events, and semester exam results. The Complaint Box section has a text input form to submit a complaint.

quotes: give only access see to marks and attendance events and semester

acceptanceCriteria: All four read-only sections display only the logged-in student's data
Complaint Box allows typing and submitting a complaint message
No edit or delete controls are shown to students
Events section shows all school events

requirements.text: Apply a clean, professional school-themed visual design across the entire app. Use a color palette of deep navy and white with gold accents, clear sans-serif typography, a structured sidebar layout for dashboards, and card-based content sections. Ensure the design is consistent across teacher and student views.
acceptanceCriteria: Color palette is consistently applied across all pages
Typography is legible and professional
Dashboard layout uses a sidebar for navigation
Cards or panels are used for content sections

requirements.text: Generate and display a school logo/crest illustration used on the login page and dashboard header.
acceptanceCriteria: Logo appears on the login page centered above the login form
Logo appears in the dashboard header/sidebar top
Image is served from frontend/public/assets/generated

constraints: Teacher dashboard must be completely inaccessible to students â€” role-based access must be enforced on both frontend and backend
Students may only view their own data; they must not be able to access other students' records
All Motoko logic must remain in a single actor in backend/main.mo
Do not use external authentication providers; use a simple username/password system stored in backend state
nonGoals: Mobile app or responsive-only design beyond standard web

required: Flat illustration of a school crest / shield logo with a book and star motif in navy and gold tones (school-logo.dim_256x256.png)
